message.content:
cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.CG, cs.DM, cs.SI. 

The paper presents an algorithmic approach to reconstructing directed rooted trees, which is a problem in data structures (cs.DS). The algorithm is randomized and involves making path queries, which suggests that it may involve some form of machine learning or artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The problem of reconstructing trees is also relevant to computational geometry (cs.CG), as trees are often used to represent geometric structures. The paper also discusses lower bounds on the number of queries required, which is a topic in discrete mathematics (cs.DM). Finally, the paper presents algorithms for noisy and additive queries, which suggests that it may be relevant to signal processing or information theory (cs.SI).
